Entities.Name: Drug
Entities.Definition: Name of the ophthalmologic medication, including generic, brand, and abbreviations.

Entities.Name: Frequency
Entities.Definition: How often the drug should be administered.

Entities.Name: Route
Entities.Definition: The method by which the medication is administered.

Entities.Name: Dosage
Entities.Definition: The quantity of medication to be administered at a time.

Entities.Name: Duration
Entities.Definition: The length of time over which the medication is taken.

Entities.Name: Strength
Entities.Definition: Concentration or strength of the drug.

Entities.Name: Adherence
Entities.Definition: Patient-reported or clinician-observed medication adherence behavior.

Entities.Name: Current Medication Use
Entities.Definition: Mentions of medications the patient is actively using at the time of the encounter.

Dataset.Name: Casey Eye Institute Glaucoma Progress Notes Dataset
Dataset.Description: 507 manually annotated ophthalmology progress notes from Casey Eye Institute (OHSU), specifically focused on glaucoma patient visits. Notes were annotated for 8 entity types related to medication and adherence.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Annotation was done using Doccano. Annotators labeled medication names, dosage, route, frequency, duration, strength, adherence, and current medication use based on free-text narratives. RxNorm was used to normalize medication names for reconciliation. BIO tagging was used for model training.
